One Domain Model for the Library System

From Concepts to Objects

  • Domain ê°œë…ì€ classesì™€ ì–´ë–»ê²Œ ë‹¤ë¥¸ê°€?
    • ëª¨ë“  ê°œë…ì´ classê°€ ë˜ì–´ì•¼ í•˜ëŠ”ê°€?

Object Diagrams

  • Fieldsì™€ methodsë¥¼ ê°€ì§„ Objects/classes
  • Methodsë¥¼ ê°€ì§„ Interfaces
  • Associations, visibility, types

Object Diagram Notation: Classes/Objects

class LibraryAccount {
  id: int;
  lateFees: int;
  boolean borrow(Book b) { ... }
  void returnItem(Book b) { ... }
  void payFees(int payment) { ... }
}

Object Diagram Notation: Interfaces

interface LibraryAccount {
  boolean borrow(Book b);
  void returnItem(Book b);
  void payFees(int payment);
}

Object Diagram Notation: Associations

class LibraryAccount {
  ...
  List<Book> borrowedBooks;
}
class Book {
  ...
  LibraryAccount borrowedBy;
}
  • Fieldsë¥¼ associations ëŒ€ì‹  ë˜ëŠ” ì¶”ê°€ë¡œ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ì§€ ë§ ê²ƒ
  • FieldsëŠ” ê¸°ë³¸ typesì—ë§Œ ì‚¬ìš©

Class Diagram vs Object Diagram

  • Classesì™€ objects ë‘˜ ë‹¤ modeling ê°€ëŠ¥
  • ìš©ì–´ëŠ” ì¢…ì¢… í˜¼ìš©ë¨
  • íŠ¹ì • objectsë¥¼ modelingí•´ì•¼ í•˜ëŠ” ê²½ìš° objectId: Class í‘œê¸°ë²• ì‚¬ìš©

Class Diagrams and JavaScript/TypeScript

  • Classesë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ì§€ ì•Šì„ ë•Œì—ë„, ë™ì¼í•œ ì•„ì´ë””ì–´ë¥¼ í‘œí˜„í•˜ê¸° ìœ„í•´ í‘œê¸°ë²• ì‚¬ìš©
    • ë™ì¼í•œ shapeì„ ê³µìœ í•˜ëŠ” ë§ì€ objects

    return {
      borrow: function (book) { ... },
      returnItem: function (book) { ... },
      payFees: function (payment) { ... }
    }
}

Design Principle: Low Representational Gap

2025.11.5.(ëª©)

Low Representational Gap

  • ì‹ë³„ëœ ê°œë…ì€ êµ¬í˜„ ì‹œ classesì— ëŒ€í•œ ì˜ê°ì„ ì œê³µ
  • Domain ê°œë…ì„ ë°˜ì˜í•˜ëŠ” ClassesëŠ” ì¢…ì¢… ì´í•´í•˜ê¸° ì§ê´€ì ì´ë©°, ê±°ì˜ ë³€ê²½ë˜ì§€ ì•ŠìŒ (low representational gap)

  • ê° domain classì— ëŒ€í•´ software class ìƒì„±, í•´ë‹¹ ê´€ê³„ ìƒì„±
  • Design goal: ë³€ê²½ì„ ìœ„í•œ ì„¤ê³„
  • ì´ê²ƒì€ ë‹¨ì§€ ì‹œì‘ì 
    • ëª¨ë“  domain classesê°€ software ëŒ€ì‘ë¬¼ì„ í•„ìš”ë¡œ í•˜ì§€ëŠ” ì•ŠìŒ
    • Pure fabricationsê°€ í•„ìš”í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆìŒ
    • ë‹¤ë¥¸ ì›ì¹™ë“¤ì´ ì¢…ì¢… ë” ì¤‘ìš”

Design Principle: Low Coupling

  • Moduleì€ ê°€ëŠ¥í•œ í•œ ì ì€ ìˆ˜ì˜ ë‹¤ë¥¸ modulesì— ì˜ì¡´í•´ì•¼ í•¨

High Coupling is Undesirable

  • Low couplingì„ ê°€ì§„ elementëŠ” ì ì€ ìˆ˜ì˜ ë‹¤ë¥¸ elementsì— ì˜ì¡´

  • High couplingì„ ê°€ì§„ classëŠ” ë§ì€ ë‹¤ë¥¸ classesì— ì˜ì¡´

Design Goals, Principles, and Patterns

  • Design Goals: ë³€ê²½, ì´í•´, ì¬ì‚¬ìš©, ë¶„ì—… ë“±ì„ ìœ„í•œ ì„¤ê³„

Design Heuristic: Law of Demeter

  • ê° moduleì€ ë‹¤ë¥¸ unitsì— ëŒ€í•´ ì œí•œëœ ì§€ì‹ë§Œ ê°€ì ¸ì•¼ í•¨
    • í˜„ì¬ unitê³¼ "ë°€ì ‘í•˜ê²Œ" ê´€ë ¨ëœ unitsë§Œ
  • íŠ¹íˆ, ë‚¯ì„  ì´ì—ê²Œ ë§ ê±¸ì§€ ë§ ê²ƒ (Donâ€™t talk to strangers!)
    • ì˜ˆ: a.getB().getC().foo() ê¸ˆì§€
for (let i of shipment.getBox().getItems())
    shipmentWeight += i.getWeight() ...

So don't do this ^ !!

Coupling: Discussion

  • ë§¤ìš° ì•ˆì •ì ì¸ elementsì— ëŒ€í•œ high couplingì€ ë³´í†µ ë¬¸ì œë˜ì§€ ì•ŠìŒ
    • ì•ˆì •ì ì¸ interfaceëŠ” ë³€ê²½ë  ê°€ëŠ¥ì„±ì´ ë‚®ê³ , ì˜ ì´í•´ë¨
    • Implementationsì— ëŒ€í•œ couplingë³´ë‹¤ interfacesì— ëŒ€í•œ coupling ì„ í˜¸
  • Subclass/superclass couplingì€ íŠ¹íˆ ê°•ë ¥í•¨
    • Protected fieldsì™€ methodsê°€ ë…¸ì¶œë¨
    • SubclassëŠ” ë§ì€ superclass ë³€ê²½(ì˜ˆ: method signatures ë³€ê²½, abstract methods ì¶”ê°€)ì— ì·¨ì•½
    • Guideline: Couplingì„ ì¤„ì´ê¸° ìœ„í•´, ìƒì†(inheritance)ë³´ë‹¤ composition ì„ í˜¸
  • Couplingì€ ë§ì€ ì›ì¹™ ì¤‘ í•˜ë‚˜
    • Cohesion, low repr. gap ë° ê¸°íƒ€ ì›ì¹™ë„ ê³ ë ¤

Design Goals

  • Low couplingì´ ì§€ì›í•˜ëŠ” ë°©ì‹ ì„¤ëª…:
    • Design for change (ë³€ê²½ì„ ìœ„í•œ ì„¤ê³„)
      • ë” ì ì€ ìˆ˜ì˜ ë‹¤ë¥¸ objectsì— ëŒ€í•œ ì˜ì¡´ì„±ìœ¼ë¡œ ë³€ê²½ì´ ë” ì‰¬ì›€

    • Design for understandability (ì´í•´ë¥¼ ìœ„í•œ ì„¤ê³„)
      • ì´í•´í•´ì•¼ í•  ì˜ì¡´ì„±ì´ ì ìŒ (ì˜ˆ: a.getB().getC().foo())
    • Design for division of labor (ë¶„ì—…ì„ ìœ„í•œ ì„¤ê³„)
      • ë” ì‘ì€ interfaces, ë¶„í•  ìš©ì´
    • Design for reuse (ì¬ì‚¬ìš©ì„ ìœ„í•œ ì„¤ê³„)
      • ë³µì¡í•œ ì˜ì¡´ì„± ì—†ì´ ì¬ì‚¬ìš© ìš©ì´

Design Heuristic: Controller (also Design Pattern: FAÃ‡ADE)

  • Problem: ì–´ë–¤ ê°ì²´ê°€ system operation (event)ì„ ìˆ˜ì‹ í•˜ê³  ì¡°ì •í•˜ëŠ”ê°€?
  • Solution: ë‹¤ìŒì„ ë‚˜íƒ€ë‚´ëŠ” ê°ì²´ì— ì±…ì„ í• ë‹¹
    • ì „ì²´ system, device, ë˜ëŠ” subsystem (faÃ§ade controller)
    • System eventê°€ ë°œìƒí•˜ëŠ” use case scenario (use case controller)
  • Process: System sequence diagramì—ì„œ ë„ì¶œ (í•µì‹¬ ì›ì¹™: Low representational gap, high cohesion)

Controller: Discussion

  • ControllerëŠ” coordinator

Controller: Design Trade-off

  • Coupling ê°ì†Œ
    • User interfaceì™€ domain logicì´ ì„œë¡œ ë¶„ë¦¬ë¨ (decoupled)
  • ì´í•´ë„: ê³ ë¦½ëœ ìƒíƒœì—ì„œ ì´í•´ ê°€ëŠ¥, ë‹¤ìŒìœ¼ë¡œ ì´ì–´ì§:

    • ë‘˜ ë‹¤ controllerì— ê²°í•©(coupled)ë˜ì–´, controllerê°€ ì¤‘ì¬ì(mediator) ì—­í• . ì´ couplingì€ ëœ í•´ë¡œì›€
    • ControllerëŠ” ë” ì‘ê³  ì•ˆì •ì ì¸ interface
    • Domain logic ë³€ê²½ì´ UIê°€ ì•„ë‹Œ controllerì— ì˜í–¥
    • Domain logic designì„ ëª°ë¼ë„ UI ë³€ê²½ ê°€ëŠ¥
  • ì¬ì‚¬ìš©ì„± ì§€ì›

Design Principle: High Cohesion

(OR SINGLE RESPONSIBILITY PRINCIPLE)

Design Principle: Cohesion

  • Moduleì€ ì‘ê³  ê´€ë ¨ëœ ì±…ì„ ì§‘í•©ì„ ê°€ì ¸ì•¼ í•¨
    • ì´í•´ë„ í–¥ìƒ (ì´í•´ë¥¼ ìœ„í•œ ì„¤ê³„)
      • ì‘ì€ ì±…ì„ ì§‘í•©ì´ ì´í•´í•˜ê¸° ë” ì‰¬ì›€
    • ì¬ì‚¬ìš©ì„± í–¥ìƒ (ì¬ì‚¬ìš©ì„ ìœ„í•œ ì„¤ê³„)

Example: Low Cohesion

class DatabaseApplication {
    public void authorizeOrder(Data data, User currentUser, ...){
      // check authorization
      // lock objects for synchronization
      // validate buffer
      // log start of operation
      // perform operation
      // log end of operation
      // release lock on objects
    }

    public void startShipping(OtherData data, User currentUser, ...){
      // check authorization
      // lock objects for synchronization
      // validate buffer
      // log start of operation
      // perform operation
      // log end of operation
      // release lock on objects
    }
}

Anti-Pattern: God Object

class Chat {
    List<String> channels;
    Map<String, List<Msg>> messages;
    Map<String, String> accounts;
    Set<String> bannedUsers;
    File logFile;
    File bannedWords;
    URL serverAddress;
    Map<String, Int> globalSettings;
    Map<String, Int> userSettings;
    Map<String, Graphic> smileys;
    CryptStrategy encryption;
    Widget sendButton, messageList;
}

class Chat {
    Content content;
    AccountMgr accounts;
    File logFile;
    ConnectionMgr conns;
}

class ChatUI {
    Chat chat;
    Widget sendButton, ...;
}

class AccountMgr {
    ... accounts, bannedUsers ...
}

Cohesion in Graph Implementations

class Graph {
    Node[] nodes;
    boolean[] isVisited;
}

class Algorithm {
    int shortestPath(Graph g, Node n, Node m) {
      for (int i; ...) {
        if (!g.isVisited[i]) {
            ...
            g.isVisited[i] = true;
        }
      }
      return v;
    }
}
  • ì´ê²ƒì´ ì¢‹ì€ êµ¬í˜„ì¸ê°€?
  • No, graphê°€ dataë¿ë§Œ ì•„ë‹ˆë¼ ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ì  ì±…ì„ê¹Œì§€ ë§¡ê³  ìˆê¸° ë•Œë¬¸

Bluemarble Example

  • ì–´ëŠ ë””ìì¸ì´ ë” ë†’ì€ cohesionì„ ê°€ì§€ëŠ”ê°€?
class Player {
    Board board;
    /* in code somewhere... */ this.getSquare(n);
    Square getSquare(String name) { // named squares
      for (Square s: board.getSquares())
        if (s.getName().equals(name))
            return s;
      return null;
    }
}

class Player {
    Board board;
    /* in code somewhere... */ board.getSquare(n);
}

class Board {
    List<Square> squares;
    Square getSquare(String name) {
      for (Square s: squares)
        if (s.getName().equals(name))
            return s;
      return null;
    }
}

Coupling vs Cohesion (ê·¹ë‹¨ì  ì¼€ì´ìŠ¤)

  • ëª¨ë“  ì½”ë“œê°€ í•˜ë‚˜ì˜ class/methodì—

Design Heuristic: Information Expert

Design Heuristic: Creator

Creator (Design Heuristic)
